name: Momo
short_description: Originating from Tibet, these delightful dumplings boast a variety of fillings, from savory minced meat to fresh vegetables and creamy cheese. Steamed to perfection, they offer a burst of flavor in every bite.

name: Dal bhat
short_description: A beloved staple of Nepalese cuisine, dal bhat features fluffy rice paired with savory lentil soup, often enriched with spices. Served with vibrant side dishes, each bite offers a warm taste of tradition.

name: Baji
short_description: Pounded rice from Nepal, Baji is a beloved snack offering a delightful crunch. Often enjoyed with savory curries or refreshing yogurt, it energizes field workers and food lovers alike.

name: Sekuwa
short_description: Grilled to perfection, skewered meats like lamb, chicken, pork, or goat are marinated in fragrant herbs and spices in this beloved Nepalese street food. Each bite bursts with smoky, savory flavor.

name: Sukuti
short_description: Features tender slices of marinated lamb, dried to perfection and infused with the bold flavors of cumin, turmeric, and black pepper. A cherished Nepali snack, it offers a savory, spicy bite that delights the senses.

name: Gundruk
short_description: Fermented and dried leafy greens like mustard and radish leaves create Gundruk, a tangy staple in Nepali cuisine. Its unique sourness adds depth to soups and curries, showcasing traditional preservation methods.

name: Phuchka
short_description: Crispy puris cradle a zesty blend of spiced potatoes and chickpeas, drizzled with tangy tamarind water. A beloved Nepali street snack, Phuchka bursts with vibrant flavors in every bite.

name: Kwati
short_description: Originating from Nepal, this hearty stew blends a medley of beans, simmering in aromatic spices for a rich, earthy flavor. Kwati is a festive favorite, symbolizing unity and nourishment.

name: Khasi ko masu
short_description: Goat meat simmers tenderly in a fragrant blend of garam masala, turmeric, cloves, and cinnamon, creating a beloved Nepali stew. Each bite offers a warm taste of tradition and comfort.

name: Yomari
short_description: Delicate rice flour dumplings from Nepal, Yomari are filled with sweet molasses and coconut, steamed to perfection. Celebrated during festivals, they offer a warm, rich taste of tradition.

name: Fried Ring Bread (Sel roti)
short_description: A beloved festive treat in Nepal, fried ring bread combines aromatic rice flour with sugar, butter, and fragrant spices like cardamom. Its crispy exterior and soft, sweet center make it irresistible.

name: Choila
short_description: A cherished Newari specialty, choila features tender, grilled water buffalo, chicken, or mutton, marinated in a fiery blend of green and red chilis, delivering a bold, spicy kick with every bite.

name: Kachilā
short_description: Originating from the Newari community of Nepal, Kachilā features finely minced raw water buffalo, chicken, or lamb, expertly blended with garlic, coriander, and spices for a spicy, savory delight.

name: Machhak jhora
short_description: A beloved Nepali stew, Machhak jhora features tender Ilish, Rohu, and Catla simmered with potatoes and tomatoes in a fragrant, spiced broth. It captures the essence of home-cooked comfort.

name: Thekua
short_description: Crispy and fragrant, this traditional Nepalese dessert marries whole-wheat flour, grated coconut, and warm spices like cardamom and fennel. Deep-fried in ghee, it delivers a delightful crunch and rich flavor.

name: Alu tama
short_description: Experience the heart of Nepal with a comforting bowl of Alu Tama, where tender bamboo shoots and hearty potatoes blend in a savory, tangy broth. This unique soup showcases the rich flavors of traditional Himalayan cuisine.

name: Chunla
short_description: Originating from the Kathmandu Valley, finely chopped water buffalo meat is expertly kneaded with aromatic spices in Chunla. This savory ground meat dish bursts with flavor, embodying Nepalese culinary tradition.

name: Chatamari
short_description: Originating from the Newar community in Kathmandu, this savory rice flour bread is topped with eggs, succulent chicken, and fresh coriander, offering a delightful twist on traditional pizza.

name: Samay baji
short_description: A vibrant Newari feast, Samay baji combines fluffy pounded and puffed rice with savory elements like spiced lentils and pickles. Celebrated for its cultural significance, it symbolizes prosperity and well-being.

name: Pukala
short_description: Boiled and fried water buffalo meat, Pukala is a beloved traditional dish from the Kathmandu Valley. A savory mix of liver and tripe delivers rich, bold flavors that showcase Nepalese culinary heritage.

name: Bandel karang
short_description: Originating from Nepal, tender pork ribs simmer in a savory blend of soy sauce, garlic, and five-spice powder, creating a mouthwatering dish with a perfect balance of heat and umami.

name: Haku choila
short_description: Originating from the Newar community of Nepal, haku choila features succulent water buffalo marinated in a fiery blend of garlic, ginger, and hot peppers, delivering bold flavors in every bite.

name: Dhindo
short_description: Thick and hearty, this traditional Nepalese porridge features ground millet or cornmeal, expertly cooked in a cast-iron taapke. A staple in the mountainous regions, it offers earthy flavors and comforting warmth.

name: Kinema
short_description: Fermented soya beans create a sticky, flavorful side dish cherished in Nepalese cuisine. With a bold, slightly pungent aroma, kinema adds a unique twist to any meal, embodying local traditions.
